titles.title: To require that the Bureau of the Census prepare and submit to Congress a detailed plan for counting overseas Americans in future decennial censuses, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Census.

bill.summary: 6/14/2001--Introduced. Prohibits the Department of Commerce from obligating any amount to implement the 2003 American Community Survey until: (1) the Director of the Census has submitted to the Secretary of Commerce a plan for the counting of overseas Americans in future decennial censuses of population; (2) the Secretary has certified that the Secretary has approved such a plan and that all necessary implementing regulations have been promulgated; and (3) the Secretary has submitted a report justifying the decision of the Bureau of the Census, in connection with the 1990 and 2000 censuses, to count overseas Americans selectively.
